info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 4:59PM MDT until May 25 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, southwestern Arapahoe.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 458 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas may cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the area around Cherry Creek Reservoir and across southern Aurora.
- Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... southwestern Aurora, eastern Centennial, Greenwood Village, Cherry Hills Village, Foxfield and Cherry Creek Reservoir.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING
